LMNL.text: I rode one evening with Count Maddalo
Upon the bank of land which breaks the flow
Of Adria towards Venice: a bare strand
Of hillocks, heaped from ever-shifting sand,
Matted with thistles and amphibious weeds,
Such as from earth’s embrace the salt ooze breeds,
Is this; an uninhabited sea-side,
Which the lone fisher, when his nets are dried,
Abandons; and no other object breaks
The waste, but one dwarf tree and some few stakes
Broken and unrepaired, and the tide makes
A narrow space of level sand thereon,
Where ’twas our wont to ride while day went down.
This ride was my delight. I love all waste
And solitary places; where we taste
The pleasure of believing what we see
Is boundless, as we wish our souls to be:
And such was this wide ocean, and this shore
More barren than its billows; and yet more
Than all, with a remembered friend I love
To ride as then I rode;—for the winds drove
The living spray along the sunny air
Into our faces; the blue heavens were bare,
Stripped to their depths by the awakening north;
And, from the waves, sound like delight broke forth
Harmonising with solitude, and sent
Into our hearts aereal merriment.
So, as we rode, we talked; and the swift thought,
Winging itself with laughter, lingered not,
But flew from brain to brain,—such glee was ours,
Charged with light memories of remembered hours,
None slow enough for sadness: till we came
Homeward, which always makes the spirit tame.
This day had been cheerful but cold, and now
The sun was sinking, and the wind also.
Our talk grew somewhat serious, as may be
Talk interrupted with such raillery
As mocks itself, because it cannot scorn
The thoughts it would extinguish: —’twas forlorn,
Yet pleasing, such as once, so poets tell,
The devils held within the dales of Hell
Concerning God, freewill and destiny:
Of all that earth has been or yet may be,
All that vain men imagine or believe,
Or hope can paint or suffering may achieve,
We descanted; and I (for ever still
Is it not wise to make the best of ill?)
Argued against despondency, but pride
Made my companion take the darker side.
The sense that he was greater than his kind
Had struck, methinks, his eagle spirit blind
By gazing on its own exceeding light.
Meanwhile the sun paused ere it should alight,
Over the horizon of the mountains;—Oh,
How beautiful is sunset, when the glow
Of Heaven descends upon a land like thee,
Thou Paradise of exiles, Italy!
Thy mountains, seas and vineyards, and the towers
Of cities they encircle!—it was ours
To stand on thee, beholding it: and then,
Just where we had dismounted, the Count’s men
Were waiting for us with the gondola.—
As those who pause on some delightful way
Though bent on pleasant pilgrimage, we stood
Looking upon the evening, and the flood
Which lay between the city and the shore,
Paved with the image of the sky … the hoar
And aery Alps towards the North appeared
Through mist, an heaven-sustaining bulwark reared
Between the East and West; and half the sky
Was roofed with clouds of rich emblazonry
Dark purple at the zenith, which still grew
Down the steep West into a wondrous hue
Brighter than burning gold, even to the rent
Where the swift sun yet paused in his descent
Among the many-folded hills: they were
Those famous Euganean hills, which bear,
As seen from Lido thro’ the harbour piles,
The likeness of a clump of peaked isles—
And then—as if the Earth and Sea had been
Dissolved into one lake of fire, were seen
Those mountains towering as from waves of flame
Around the vaporous sun, from which there came
The inmost purple spirit of light, and made
Their very peaks transparent.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r128_lg r130_l r131_q

LMNL.text: Ere it fade,
Said my companion,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r132_lg r133_l r134_q

LMNL.text: I will show you soon

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r132_lg r134_q r135_l

LMNL.text: A better station
—so, o’er the lagune
We glided; and from that funereal bark
I leaned, and saw the city, and could mark
How from their many isles, in evening’s gleam,
Its temples and its palaces did seem
Like fabrics of enchantment piled to Heaven.
I was about to speak, when—

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r142_lg r144_l r145_q

LMNL.text: We are even

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r145_q r146_lg r147_l

LMNL.text: Now at the point I meant,
said Maddalo,
And bade the gondolieri cease to row.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r149_lg r150_q r151_l

LMNL.text: Look, Julian, on the west, and listen well

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r149_lg r150_q r152_l

LMNL.text: If you hear not a deep and heavy bell.
I looked, and saw between us and the sun
A building on an island; such a one
As age to age might add, for uses vile,
A windowless, deformed and dreary pile;
And on the top an open tower, where hung
A bell, which in the radiance swayed and swung;
We could just hear its hoarse and iron tongue:
The broad sun sunk behind it, and it tolled
In strong and black relief.—

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r163_lg r165_l r166_q

LMNL.text: What we behold

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r166_q r167_lg r168_l

LMNL.text: Shall be the madhouse and its belfry tower,
Said Maddalo,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r167_lg r169_l r170_q

LMNL.text: and ever at this hour

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r170_q r171_lg r172_l

LMNL.text: Those who may cross the water, hear that bell

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r170_q r171_lg r173_l

LMNL.text: Which calls the maniacs, each one from his cell,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r170_q r174_lg r175_l

LMNL.text: To vespers.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r174_lg r175_l r176_q

LMNL.text: As much skill as need to pray

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r174_lg r176_q r177_l

LMNL.text: In thanks or hope for their dark lot have they

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r176_q r178_lg r179_l

LMNL.text: To their stern maker,
I replied.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r178_lg r179_l r180_q

LMNL.text: O ho!

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r178_lg r180_q r181_l

LMNL.text: You talk as in years past,
said Maddalo.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r182_lg r183_q r184_l

LMNL.text: ’Tis strange men change not. You were ever still

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r182_lg r183_q r185_l

LMNL.text: Among Christ’s flock a perilous infidel,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r183_q r186_lg r187_l

LMNL.text: A wolf for the meek lambs—if you can’t swim

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r183_q r186_lg r188_l

LMNL.text: Beware of Providence.
I looked on him,
But the gay smile had faded in his eye.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r189_lg r191_l r192_q

LMNL.text: And such,
— he cried,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r189_lg r191_l r193_q

LMNL.text: is our mortality,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r193_q r194_lg r195_l

LMNL.text: And this must be the emblem and the sign

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r193_q r194_lg r196_l

LMNL.text: Of what should be eternal and divine! —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r193_q r197_lg r198_l

LMNL.text: And like that black and dreary bell, the soul,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r193_q r197_lg r199_l

LMNL.text: Hung in a heaven-illumined tower, must toll

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r193_q r200_lg r201_l

LMNL.text: Our thoughts and our desires to meet below

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r193_q r200_lg r202_l

LMNL.text: Round the rent heart and pray — as madmen do

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r193_q r203_lg r204_l

LMNL.text: For what? they know not, — till the night of death

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r193_q r203_lg r205_l

LMNL.text: As sunset that strange vision, severeth

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r193_q r206_lg r207_l

LMNL.text: Our memory from itself, and us from all

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r003_verse-para r193_q r206_lg r208_l

LMNL.text: We sought and yet were baffled.
I recall
The sense of what he said, although I mar
The force of his expressions. The broad star
Of day meanwhile had sunk behind the hill,
And the black bell became invisible,
And the red tower looked gray, and all between
The churches, ships and palaces were seen
Huddled in gloom; — into the purple sea
The orange hues of heaven sunk silently.
We hardly spoke, and soon the gondola
Conveyed me to my lodging by the way.
The following morn was rainy, cold, and dim:
Ere Maddalo arose, I called on him,
And whilst I waited with his child I played;
A lovelier toy sweet Nature never made;
A serious, subtle, wild, yet gentle being,
Graceful without design and unforeseeing,
With eyes — Oh speak not of her eyes! — which seem
Twin mirrors of Italian Heaven, yet gleam
With such deep meaning, as we never see
But in the human countenance: with me
She was a special favourite: I had nursed
Her fine and feeble limbs when she came first
To this bleak world; and she yet seemed to know
On second sight her ancient playfellow,
Less changed than she was by six months or so;
For after her first shyness was worn out
We sate there, rolling billiard balls about,
When the Count entered. Salutations past —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r250_lg r252_q r253_l

LMNL.text: The word you spoke last night might well have cast

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r252_q r254_lg r255_l

LMNL.text: A darkness on my spirit — if man be

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r252_q r254_lg r256_l

LMNL.text: The passive thing you say, I should not see

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r252_q r257_lg r258_l

LMNL.text: Much harm in the religions and old saws

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r252_q r257_lg r259_l

LMNL.text: (Tho’ I may never own such leaden laws)

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r252_q r260_lg r261_l

LMNL.text: Which break a teachless nature to the yoke:

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r252_q r260_lg r262_l

LMNL.text: Mine is another faith.
— thus much I spoke
And noting he replied not, added:

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r263_lg r264_l r265_q

LMNL.text: See

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r263_lg r265_q r266_l

LMNL.text: This lovely child, blithe, innocent and free;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r265_q r267_lg r268_l

LMNL.text: She spends a happy time with little care,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r265_q r267_lg r269_l

LMNL.text: While we to such sick thoughts subjected are

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r265_q r270_lg r271_l

LMNL.text: As came on you last night. It is our will

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r265_q r270_lg r272_l

LMNL.text: That thus enchains us to permitted ill —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r265_q r273_lg r274_l

LMNL.text: We might be otherwise — we might be all

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r265_q r273_lg r275_l

LMNL.text: We dream of happy, high, majestical.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r265_q r276_lg r277_l

LMNL.text: Where is the love, beauty, and truth we seek,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r265_q r276_lg r278_l

LMNL.text: But in our mind? and if we were not weak

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r265_q r279_lg r280_l

LMNL.text: Should we be less in deed than in desire?

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r279_lg r281_q r282_l

LMNL.text: Ay, if we were not weak — and we aspire

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r281_q r283_lg r284_l

LMNL.text: How vainly to be strong!
said Maddalo:

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r283_lg r285_l r286_q

LMNL.text: You talk Utopia.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r283_lg r285_l r287_q

LMNL.text: It remains to know,
I then rejoined,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r288_lg r289_l r290_q

LMNL.text: and those who try may find

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r288_lg r290_q r291_l

LMNL.text: How strong the chains are which our spirit bind;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r290_q r292_lg r293_l

LMNL.text: Brittle perchance as straw … We are assured

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r290_q r292_lg r294_l

LMNL.text: Much may be conquered, much may be endured,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r290_q r295_lg r296_l

LMNL.text: Of what degrades and crushes us. We know

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r290_q r295_lg r297_l

LMNL.text: That we have power over ourselves to do

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r290_q r298_lg r299_l

LMNL.text: And suffer — what, we know not till we try;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r290_q r298_lg r300_l

LMNL.text: But something nobler than to live and die —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r290_q r298_lg r301_l

LMNL.text: So taught those kings of old philosophy

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r290_q r302_lg r303_l

LMNL.text: Who reigned, before Religion made men blind;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r290_q r302_lg r304_l

LMNL.text: And those who suffer with their suffering kind

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r290_q r305_lg r306_l

LMNL.text: Yet feel their faith, religion.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r305_lg r306_l r307_q

LMNL.text: My dear friend,
Said Maddalo,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r305_lg r308_l r309_q

LMNL.text: my judgement will not bend

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r309_q r310_lg r311_l

LMNL.text: To your opinion, though I think you might

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r309_q r310_lg r312_l

LMNL.text: Make such a system refutation-tight

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r309_q r313_lg r314_l

LMNL.text: As far as words go. I knew one like you

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r309_q r313_lg r315_l

LMNL.text: Who to this city came some months ago,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r309_q r316_lg r317_l

LMNL.text: With whom I argued in this sort, and he

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r309_q r316_lg r318_l

LMNL.text: Is now gone mad, — and so he answered me, —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r309_q r319_lg r320_l

LMNL.text: Poor fellow! but if you would like to go,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r309_q r319_lg r321_l

LMNL.text: We’ll visit him, and his wild talk will show

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r309_q r322_lg r323_l

LMNL.text: How vain are such aspiring theories.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r322_lg r324_q r325_l

LMNL.text: I hope to prove the induction otherwise,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r324_q r326_lg r327_l

LMNL.text: And that a want of that true theory, still,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r324_q r326_lg r328_l

LMNL.text: Which seeks a

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r324_q r326_lg r328_l r329_soCalled

LMNL.text: soul of goodness

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r324_q r326_lg r328_l

LMNL.text: in things ill

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r324_q r330_lg r331_l

LMNL.text: Or in himself or others, has thus bowed

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r324_q r330_lg r332_l

LMNL.text: His being — there are some by nature proud,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r324_q r333_lg r334_l

LMNL.text: Who patient in all else demand but this —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r324_q r333_lg r335_l

LMNL.text: To love and be beloved with gentleness;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r324_q r336_lg r337_l

LMNL.text: And being scorned, what wonder if they die

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r224_verse-para r324_q r336_lg r338_l

LMNL.text: Some living death? this is not destiny
But man’s own wilful ill.
As thus I spoke
Servants announced the gondola, and we
Through the fast-falling rain and high-wrought sea
Sailed to the island where the madhouse stands.
We disembarked. The clap of tortured hands,
Fierce yells and howlings and lamentings keen,
And laughter where complaint had merrier been,
Moans, shrieks, and curses, and blaspheming prayers
Accosted us. We climbed the oozy stairs
Into an old courtyard. I heard on high,
Then, fragments of most touching melody,
But looking up saw not the singer there —
Through the black bars in the tempestuous air
I saw, like weeds on a wrecked palace growing,
Long tangled locks flung wildly forth, and flowing,
Of those who on a sudden were beguiled
Into strange silence, and looked forth and smiled
Hearing sweet sounds. Then I:

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r365_lg r366_l r367_q

LMNL.text: Methinks there were

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r365_lg r367_q r368_l

LMNL.text: A cure of these with patience and kind care,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r367_q r369_lg r370_l

LMNL.text: If music can thus move … but what is he

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r367_q r369_lg r371_l

LMNL.text: Whom we seek here?

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r369_lg r371_l r372_q

LMNL.text: Of his sad history

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r372_q r373_lg r374_l

LMNL.text: I know but this,
said Maddalo:

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r373_lg r374_l r375_q

LMNL.text: he came

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r373_lg r375_q r376_l

LMNL.text: To Venice a dejected man, and fame

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r375_q r377_lg r378_l

LMNL.text: Said he was wealthy, or he had been so;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r375_q r377_lg r379_l

LMNL.text: Some thought the loss of fortune wrought him woe;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r375_q r380_lg r381_l

LMNL.text: But he was ever talking in such sort

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r375_q r380_lg r382_l

LMNL.text: As you do — far more sadly — he seemed hurt,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r375_q r383_lg r384_l

LMNL.text: Even as a man with his peculiar wrong,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r375_q r383_lg r385_l

LMNL.text: To hear but of the oppression of the strong,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r375_q r386_lg r387_l

LMNL.text: Or those absurd deceits (I think with you

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r375_q r386_lg r388_l

LMNL.text: In some respects, you know) which carry through

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r375_q r389_lg r390_l

LMNL.text: The excellent impostors of this earth

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r375_q r389_lg r391_l

LMNL.text: When they outface detection — he had worth,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r375_q r392_lg r393_l

LMNL.text: Poor fellow! but a humorist in his way

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r392_lg r394_l r395_q

LMNL.text: Alas, what drove him mad?

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r392_lg r394_l r396_q

LMNL.text: I cannot say:

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r396_q r397_lg r398_l

LMNL.text: A lady came with him from France, and when

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r396_q r397_lg r399_l

LMNL.text: She left him and returned, he wandered then

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r396_q r400_lg r401_l

LMNL.text: About yon lonely isles of desert sand

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r396_q r400_lg r402_l

LMNL.text: Till he grew wild — he had no cash or land

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r396_q r403_lg r404_l

LMNL.text: Remaining, — the police had brought him here —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r396_q r403_lg r405_l

LMNL.text: Some fancy took him and he would not bear

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r396_q r406_lg r407_l

LMNL.text: Removal; so I fitted up for him

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r396_q r406_lg r408_l

LMNL.text: Those rooms beside the sea, to please his whim,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r396_q r409_lg r410_l

LMNL.text: And sent him busts and books and urns for flowers,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r396_q r409_lg r411_l

LMNL.text: Which had adorned his life in happier hours,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r396_q r412_lg r413_l

LMNL.text: And instruments of music — you may guess

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r396_q r412_lg r414_l

LMNL.text: A stranger could do little more or less

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r396_q r415_lg r416_l

LMNL.text: For one so gentle and unfortunate:

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r396_q r415_lg r417_l

LMNL.text: And those are his sweet strains which charm the weight

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r396_q r418_lg r419_l

LMNL.text: From madmen’s chains, and make this Hell appear

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r396_q r418_lg r420_l

LMNL.text: A heaven of sacred silence, hushed to hear.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r421_lg r422_q r423_l

LMNL.text: Nay, this was kind of you — he had no claim,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r421_lg r422_q r424_l

LMNL.text: As the world says

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r421_lg r424_l r425_q

LMNL.text: None — but the very same

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r425_q r426_lg r427_l

LMNL.text: Which I on all mankind were I as he

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r425_q r426_lg r428_l

LMNL.text: Fallen to such deep reverse; — his melody

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r425_q r429_lg r430_l

LMNL.text: Is interrupted — now we hear the din

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r425_q r429_lg r431_l

LMNL.text: Of madmen, shriek on shriek, again begin;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r425_q r432_lg r433_l

LMNL.text: Let us now visit him; after this strain

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r425_q r432_lg r434_l

LMNL.text: He ever communes with himself again,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r340_verse-para r425_q r435_lg r436_l

LMNL.text: And sees nor hears not any.
Having said
These words, we called the keeper, and he led
To an apartment opening on the sea —
There the poor wretch was sitting mournfully
Near a piano, his pale fingers twined
One with the other, and the ooze and wind
Rushed through an open casement, and did sway
His hair, and starred it with the brackish spray;
His head was leaning on a music book,
And he was muttering, and his lean limbs shook;
His lips were pressed against a folded leaf
In hue too beautiful for health, and grief
Smiled in their motions as they lay apart —
As one who wrought from his own fervid heart
The eloquence of passion, soon he raised
His sad meek face and eyes lustrous and glazed
And spoke — sometimes as one who wrote, and thought
His words might move some heart that heeded not,
If sent to distant lands: and then as one
Reproaching deeds never to be undone
With wondering self-compassion; then his speech
Was lost in grief, and then his words came each
Unmodulated, cold, expressionless, —
But that from one jarred accent you might guess
It was despair made them so uniform:
And all the while the loud and gusty storm
Hissed through the window, and we stood behind
Stealing his accents from the envious wind
Unseen. I yet remember what he said
Distinctly: such impression his words made.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r481_lg r482_l r483_q

LMNL.text: Month after month,
he cried,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r481_lg r482_l r484_q

LMNL.text: to bear this load

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r481_lg r484_q r485_l

LMNL.text: And as a jade urged by the whip and goad

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r486_lg r487_l

LMNL.text: To drag life on, which like a heavy chain

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r486_lg r488_l

LMNL.text: Lengthens behind with many a link of pain! —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r489_lg r490_l

LMNL.text: And not to speak my grief — O, not to dare

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r489_lg r491_l

LMNL.text: To give a human voice to my despair,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r492_lg r493_l

LMNL.text: But live, and move, and, wretched thing! smile on

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r492_lg r494_l

LMNL.text: As if I never went aside to groan,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r495_lg r496_l

LMNL.text: And wear this mask of falsehood even to those

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r495_lg r497_l

LMNL.text: Who are most dear — not for my own repose —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r498_lg r499_l

LMNL.text: Alas! no scorn or pain or hate could be

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r498_lg r500_l

LMNL.text: So heavy as that falsehood is to me —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r501_lg r502_l

LMNL.text: But that I cannot bear more altered faces

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r501_lg r503_l

LMNL.text: Than needs must be, more changed and cold embraces,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r504_lg r505_l

LMNL.text: More misery, disappointment, and mistrust

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r504_lg r506_l

LMNL.text: To own me for their father … Would the dust

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r507_lg r508_l

LMNL.text: Were covered in upon my body now!

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r507_lg r509_l

LMNL.text: That the life ceased to toil within my brow!

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r510_lg r511_l

LMNL.text: And then these thoughts would at the least be fled;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r480_verse-para r484_q r510_lg r512_l

LMNL.text: Let us not fear such pain can vex the dead.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r514_lg r515_l

LMNL.text: What Power delights to torture us? I know

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r514_lg r516_l

LMNL.text: That to myself I do not wholly owe

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r517_lg r518_l

LMNL.text: What now I suffer, though in part I may.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r517_lg r519_l

LMNL.text: Alas! none strewed sweet flowers upon the way

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r520_lg r521_l

LMNL.text: Where wandering heedlessly, I met pale Pain

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r520_lg r522_l

LMNL.text: My shadow, which will leave me not again —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r523_lg r524_l

LMNL.text: If I have erred, there was no joy in error,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r523_lg r525_l

LMNL.text: But pain and insult and unrest and terror;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r526_lg r527_l

LMNL.text: I have not as some do, bought penitence

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r526_lg r528_l

LMNL.text: With pleasure, and a dark yet sweet offence,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r529_lg r530_l

LMNL.text: For then, — if love and tenderness and truth

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r529_lg r531_l

LMNL.text: Had overlived hope’s momentary youth,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r532_lg r533_l

LMNL.text: My creed should have redeemed me from repenting;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r532_lg r534_l

LMNL.text: But loathed scorn and outrage unrelenting

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r535_lg r536_l

LMNL.text: Met love excited by far other seeming

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r535_lg r537_l

LMNL.text: Until the end was gained … as one from dreaming

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r538_lg r539_l

LMNL.text: Of sweetest peace, I woke, and found my state

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r513_verse-para r538_lg r540_l

LMNL.text: Such as it is. —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r538_lg r540_l r541_verse-para

LMNL.text: O Thou, my spirit’s mate

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r541_verse-para r542_lg r543_l

LMNL.text: Who, for thou art compassionate and wise,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r541_verse-para r542_lg r544_l

LMNL.text: Wouldst pity me from thy most gentle eyes

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r541_verse-para r545_lg r546_l

LMNL.text: If this sad writing thou shouldst ever see —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r541_verse-para r545_lg r547_l

LMNL.text: My secret groans must be unheard by thee,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r541_verse-para r548_lg r549_l

LMNL.text: Thou wouldst weep tears bitter as blood to know

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r541_verse-para r548_lg r550_l

LMNL.text: Thy lost friend’s incommunicable woe.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r552_lg r553_l

LMNL.text: Ye few by whom my nature has been weighed

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r552_lg r554_l

LMNL.text: In friendship, let me not that name degrade

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r555_lg r556_l

LMNL.text: By placing on your hearts the secret load

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r555_lg r557_l

LMNL.text: Which crushes mine to dust. There is one road

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r558_lg r559_l

LMNL.text: To peace and that is truth, which follow ye!

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r558_lg r560_l

LMNL.text: Love sometimes leads astray to misery.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r561_lg r562_l

LMNL.text: Yet think not though subdued — and I may well

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r561_lg r563_l

LMNL.text: Say that I am subdued — that the full Hell

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r564_lg r565_l

LMNL.text: Within me would infect the untainted breast

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r564_lg r566_l

LMNL.text: Of sacred nature with its own unrest;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r567_lg r568_l

LMNL.text: As some perverted beings think to find

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r567_lg r569_l

LMNL.text: In scorn or hate a medicine for the mind

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r570_lg r571_l

LMNL.text: Which scorn or hate have wounded — O how vain!

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r570_lg r572_l

LMNL.text: The dagger heals not but may rend again …

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r573_lg r574_l

LMNL.text: Believe that I am ever still the same

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r573_lg r575_l

LMNL.text: In creed as in resolve, and what may tame

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r576_lg r577_l

LMNL.text: My heart, must leave the understanding free,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r576_lg r578_l

LMNL.text: Or all would sink in this keen agony —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r579_lg r580_l

LMNL.text: Nor dream that I will join the vulgar cry;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r579_lg r581_l

LMNL.text: Or with my silence sanction tyranny;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r582_lg r583_l

LMNL.text: Or seek a moment’s shelter from my pain

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r582_lg r584_l

LMNL.text: In any madness which the world calls gain,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r585_lg r586_l

LMNL.text: Ambition or revenge or thoughts as stern

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r585_lg r587_l

LMNL.text: As those which make me what I am; or turn

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r588_lg r589_l

LMNL.text: To avarice or misanthropy or lust …

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r588_lg r590_l

LMNL.text: Heap on me soon, O grave, thy welcome dust!

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r591_lg r592_l

LMNL.text: Till then the dungeon may demand its prey,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r591_lg r593_l

LMNL.text: And Poverty and Shame may meet and say —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r591_lg r594_l

LMNL.text: Halting beside me on the public way —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r595_lg r596_q r597_l

LMNL.text: That love-devoted youth is ours — let’s sit

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r595_lg r596_q
r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r595_lg r596_q r598_l

LMNL.text: Beside him — he may live some six months yet.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r599_lg r600_l

LMNL.text: Or the red scaffold, as our country bends,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r599_lg r601_l

LMNL.text: May ask some willing victim; or ye friends

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r602_lg r603_l

LMNL.text: May fall under some sorrow which this heart

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r602_lg r604_l

LMNL.text: Or hand may share or vanquish or avert;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r605_lg r606_l

LMNL.text: I am prepared — in truth, with no proud joy —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r605_lg r607_l

LMNL.text: To do or suffer aught, as when a boy

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r608_lg r609_l

LMNL.text: I did devote to justice and to love

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r551_verse-para r608_lg r610_l

LMNL.text: My nature, worthless now!

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r608_lg r610_l r611_verse-para

LMNL.text: I must remove

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r611_verse-para r612_lg r613_l

LMNL.text: A veil from my pent mind. ’Tis torn aside!

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r611_verse-para r612_lg r614_l

LMNL.text: O, pallid as Death’s dedicated bride,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r611_verse-para r612_lg r615_l

LMNL.text: Thou mockery which art sitting by my side,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r611_verse-para r616_lg r617_l

LMNL.text: Am I not wan like thee? at the grave’s call

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r611_verse-para r616_lg r618_l

LMNL.text: I haste, invited to thy wedding-ball

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r611_verse-para r619_lg r620_l

LMNL.text: To greet the ghastly paramour, for whom

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r611_verse-para r619_lg r621_l

LMNL.text: Thou hast deserted me … and made the tomb

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r611_verse-para r622_lg r623_l

LMNL.text: Thy bridal bed … But I beside your feet

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r611_verse-para r622_lg r624_l

LMNL.text: Will lie and watch ye from my winding-sheet —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r611_verse-para r625_lg r626_l

LMNL.text: Thus … wide awake tho’ dead … yet stay, O stay!

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r611_verse-para r625_lg r627_l

LMNL.text: Go not so soon — I know not what I say —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r611_verse-para r628_lg r629_l

LMNL.text: Hear but my reasons … I am mad, I fear,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r611_verse-para r628_lg r630_l

LMNL.text: My fancy is o’erwrought … thou art not here …

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r611_verse-para r631_lg r632_l

LMNL.text: Pale art thou, ’tis most true … but thou art gone,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r611_verse-para r631_lg r633_l

LMNL.text: Thy work is finished … I am left alone! —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r634_verse-para r635_lg r636_l

LMNL.text: Nay, was it I who wooed thee to this breast

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r634_verse-para r635_lg r637_l

LMNL.text: Which, like a serpent, thou envenomest

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r634_verse-para r638_lg r639_l

LMNL.text: As in repayment of the warmth it lent?

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r634_verse-para r638_lg r640_l

LMNL.text: Didst thou not seek me for thine own content?

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r634_verse-para r641_lg r642_l

LMNL.text: Did not thy love awaken mine? I thought

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r634_verse-para r641_lg r643_l

LMNL.text: That thou wert she who said,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r634_verse-para r641_lg r643_l r644_q

LMNL.text: You kiss me not

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r634_verse-para r641_lg r644_q
r001_text r002_body r484_q r634_verse-para r644_q r645_lg
r001_text r002_body r484_q r634_verse-para r644_q r645_lg r646_l

LMNL.text: Ever, I fear you do not love me now

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r634_verse-para r645_lg r646_l
r001_text r002_body r484_q r634_verse-para r645_lg r647_l

LMNL.text: In truth I loved even to my overthrow

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r634_verse-para r648_lg r649_l

LMNL.text: Her, who would fain forget these words: but they

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r634_verse-para r648_lg r650_l

LMNL.text: Cling to her mind, and cannot pass away.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r651_verse-para r652_lg r653_l

LMNL.text: You say that I am proud — that when I speak

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r651_verse-para r652_lg r654_l

LMNL.text: My lip is tortured with the wrongs which break

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r651_verse-para r655_lg r656_l

LMNL.text: The spirit it expresses … Never one

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r651_verse-para r655_lg r657_l

LMNL.text: Humbled himself before, as I have done!

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r651_verse-para r658_lg r659_l

LMNL.text: Even the instinctive worm on which we tread

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r651_verse-para r658_lg r660_l

LMNL.text: Turns, though it wound not — then with prostrate head

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r651_verse-para r661_lg r662_l

LMNL.text: Sinks in the dusk and writhes like me — and dies?

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r651_verse-para r661_lg r663_l

LMNL.text: No: wears a living death of agonies!

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r651_verse-para r664_lg r665_l

LMNL.text: As the slow shadows of the pointed grass

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r651_verse-para r664_lg r666_l

LMNL.text: Mark the eternal periods, his pangs pass,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r651_verse-para r667_lg r668_l

LMNL.text: Slow, ever-moving, — making moments be

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r651_verse-para r667_lg r669_l

LMNL.text: As mine seem — each an immortality!

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r671_lg r672_l

LMNL.text: That you had never seen me — never heard

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r671_lg r673_l

LMNL.text: My voice, and more than all had ne’er endured

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r674_lg r675_l

LMNL.text: The deep pollution of my loathed embrace —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r674_lg r676_l

LMNL.text: That your eyes ne’er had lied love in my face —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r677_lg r678_l

LMNL.text: That, like some maniac monk, I had torn out

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r677_lg r679_l

LMNL.text: The nerves of manhood by their bleeding root

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r680_lg r681_l

LMNL.text: With mine own quivering fingers, so that ne’er

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r680_lg r682_l

LMNL.text: Our hearts had for a moment mingled there

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r683_lg r684_l

LMNL.text: To disunite in horror — these were not

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r683_lg r685_l

LMNL.text: With thee, like some suppressed and hideous thought

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r686_lg r687_l

LMNL.text: Which flits athwart our musings, but can find

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r686_lg r688_l

LMNL.text: No rest within a pure and gentle mind …

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r689_lg r690_l

LMNL.text: Thou sealedst them with many a bare broad word,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r689_lg r691_l

LMNL.text: And searedst my memory o’er them, — for I heard

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r689_lg r692_l

LMNL.text: And can forget not … they were ministered

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r693_lg r694_l

LMNL.text: One after one, those curses. Mix them up

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r693_lg r695_l

LMNL.text: Like self-destroying poisons in one cup,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r696_lg r697_l

LMNL.text: And they will make one blessing which thou ne’er

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r670_verse-para r696_lg r698_l

LMNL.text: Didst imprecate for, on me, — death.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r696_lg r698_l r699_verse-para

LMNL.text: It were

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r700_lg r701_l

LMNL.text: A cruel punishment for one most cruel,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r700_lg r702_l

LMNL.text: If such can love, to make that love the fuel

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r703_lg r704_l

LMNL.text: Of the mind’s hell; hate, scorn, remorse, despair:

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r703_lg r705_l

LMNL.text: But

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r703_lg r705_l r706_emph

LMNL.text: me

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r703_lg r705_l

LMNL.text: — whose heart a stranger’s tear might wear

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r707_lg r708_l

LMNL.text: As water-drops the sandy fountain-stone,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r707_lg r709_l

LMNL.text: Who loved and pitied all things, and could moan

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r710_lg r711_l

LMNL.text: For woes which others hear not, and could see

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r710_lg r712_l

LMNL.text: The absent with the glance of phantasy,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r713_lg r714_l

LMNL.text: And with the poor and trampled sit and weep,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r713_lg r715_l

LMNL.text: Following the captive to his dungeon deep;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r713_lg r716_l r717_emph

LMNL.text: me

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r713_lg r716_l

LMNL.text: — who am as a nerve o’er which do creep

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r718_lg r719_l

LMNL.text: The else unfelt oppressions of this earth,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r718_lg r720_l

LMNL.text: And was to thee the flame upon thy hearth,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r721_lg r722_l

LMNL.text: When all beside was cold — that thou on me

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r721_lg r723_l

LMNL.text: Shouldst rain these plagues of blistering agony —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r724_lg r725_l

LMNL.text: Such curses are from lips once eloquent

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r724_lg r726_l

LMNL.text: With love’s too partial praise — let none relent

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r727_lg r728_l

LMNL.text: Who intend deeds too dreadful for a name

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r727_lg r729_l

LMNL.text: Henceforth, if an example for the same

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r730_lg r731_l

LMNL.text: They seek … for thou on me lookedst so, and so —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r730_lg r732_l

LMNL.text: And didst speak thus … and thus … I live to show

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r699_verse-para r733_lg r734_l

LMNL.text: How much men bear and die not!

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r733_lg r734_l r735_verse-para

LMNL.text: Thou wilt tell

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r733_lg r735_verse-para r736_l

LMNL.text: With the grimace of hate, how horrible

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r735_verse-para r737_lg r738_l

LMNL.text: It was to meet my love when thine grew less;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r735_verse-para r737_lg r739_l

LMNL.text: Thou wilt admire how I could e’er address

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r735_verse-para r740_lg r741_l

LMNL.text: Such features to love’s work … this taunt, though true,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r735_verse-para r740_lg r742_l

LMNL.text: (For indeed Nature nor in form nor hue

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r735_verse-para r743_lg r744_l

LMNL.text: Bestowed on me her choicest workmanship)

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r735_verse-para r743_lg r745_l

LMNL.text: Shall not be thy defence … for since thy lip

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r735_verse-para r746_lg r747_l

LMNL.text: Met mine first, years long past, since thine eye kindled

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r735_verse-para r746_lg r748_l

LMNL.text: With soft fire under mine, I have not dwindled

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r735_verse-para r749_lg r750_l

LMNL.text: Nor changed in mind or body, or in aught

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r735_verse-para r749_lg r751_l

LMNL.text: But as love changes what it loveth not

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r735_verse-para r752_lg r753_l

LMNL.text: After long years and many trials.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r752_lg r753_l r754_verse-para

LMNL.text: How vain

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r752_lg r754_verse-para r755_l

LMNL.text: Are words! I thought never to speak again,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r754_verse-para r756_lg r757_l

LMNL.text: Not even in secret, — not to mine own heart —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r754_verse-para r756_lg r758_l

LMNL.text: But from my lips the unwilling accents start,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r754_verse-para r759_lg r760_l

LMNL.text: And from my pen the words flow as I write,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r754_verse-para r759_lg r761_l

LMNL.text: Dazzling my eyes with scalding tears … my sight

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r754_verse-para r762_lg r763_l

LMNL.text: Is dim to see that charactered in vain

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r754_verse-para r762_lg r764_l

LMNL.text: On this unfeeling leaf which burns the brain

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r754_verse-para r765_lg r766_l

LMNL.text: And eats into it … blotting all things fair

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r754_verse-para r765_lg r767_l

LMNL.text: And wise and good which time had written there.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r768_verse-para r769_lg r770_l

LMNL.text: Those who inflict must suffer, for they see

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r768_verse-para r769_lg r771_l

LMNL.text: The work of their own hearts, and this must be

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r768_verse-para r772_lg r773_l

LMNL.text: Our chastisement or recompense — O child!

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r768_verse-para r772_lg r774_l

LMNL.text: I would that thine were like to be more mild

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r768_verse-para r775_lg r776_l

LMNL.text: For both our wretched sakes … for thine the most

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r768_verse-para r775_lg r777_l

LMNL.text: Who feelest already all that thou hast lost

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r768_verse-para r778_lg r779_l

LMNL.text: Without the power to wish it thine again;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r768_verse-para r778_lg r780_l

LMNL.text: And as slow years pass, a funereal train

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r768_verse-para r781_lg r782_l

LMNL.text: Each with the ghost of some lost hope or friend

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r768_verse-para r781_lg r783_l

LMNL.text: Following it like its shadow, wilt thou bend

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r768_verse-para r784_lg r785_l

LMNL.text: No thought on my dead memory?

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r784_lg r785_l r786_verse-para

LMNL.text: Alas, love!

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r784_lg r786_verse-para r787_l

LMNL.text: Fear me not … against thee I would not move

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r788_lg r789_l

LMNL.text: A finger in despite. Do I not live

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r788_lg r790_l

LMNL.text: That thou mayst have less bitter cause to grieve?

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r791_lg r792_l

LMNL.text: I give thee tears for scorn and love for hate;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r791_lg r793_l

LMNL.text: And that thy lot may be less desolate

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r794_lg r795_l

LMNL.text: Than his on whom thou tramplest, I refrain

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r794_lg r796_l

LMNL.text: From that sweet sleep which medicines all pain.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r797_lg r798_l

LMNL.text: Then, when thou speakest of me, never say

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r797_lg r799_l r800_q

LMNL.text: He could forgive not.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r797_lg r799_l

LMNL.text: Here I cast away

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r801_lg r802_l

LMNL.text: All human passions, all revenge, all pride;

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r801_lg r803_l

LMNL.text: I think, speak, act no ill; I do but hide

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r804_lg r805_l

LMNL.text: Under these words, like embers, every spark

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r804_lg r806_l

LMNL.text: Of that which has consumed me — quick and dark

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r807_lg r808_l

LMNL.text: The grave is yawning … as its roof shall cover

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r807_lg r809_l

LMNL.text: My limbs with dust and worms under and over

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r810_lg r811_l

LMNL.text: So let Oblivion hide this grief … the air

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r810_lg r812_l

LMNL.text: Closes upon my accents, as despair

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r484_q r786_verse-para r810_lg r813_l

LMNL.text: Upon my heart — let death upon despair!
He ceased, and overcome leant back awhile,
Then rising, with a melancholy smile
Went to a sofa, and lay down, and slept
A heavy sleep, and in his dreams he wept
And muttered some familiar name, and we
Wept without shame in his society.
I think I never was impressed so much;
The man who were not, must have lacked a touch
Of human nature … then we lingered not,
Although our argument was quite forgot,
But calling the attendants, went to dine
At Maddalo’s; yet neither cheer nor wine
Could give us spirits, for we talked of him
And nothing else, till daylight made stars dim;
And we agreed his was some dreadful ill
Wrought on him boldly, yet unspeakable,
By a dear friend; some deadly change in love
Of one vowed deeply which he dreamed not of;
For whose sake he, it seemed, had fixed a blot
Of falsehood on his mind which flourished not
But in the light of all-beholding truth;
And having stamped this canker on his youth
She had abandoned him — and how much more
Might be his woe, we guessed not — he had store
Of friends and fortune once, as we could guess
From his nice habits and his gentleness;
These were now lost … it were a grief indeed
If he had changed one unsustaining reed
For all that such a man might else adorn.
The colours of his mind seemed yet unworn;
For the wild language of his grief was high,
Such as in measure were called poetry;
And I remember one remark which then
Maddalo made. He said:

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r814_verse-para r863_lg r865_l r866_q

LMNL.text: Most wretched men

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r814_verse-para r866_q r867_lg r868_l

LMNL.text: Are cradled into poetry by wrong,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r814_verse-para r866_q r867_lg r869_l

LMNL.text: They learn in suffering what they teach in song.
If I had been an unconnected man,
I, from this moment, should have formed some plan
Never to leave sweet Venice, — for to me
It was delight to ride by the lone sea;
And then, the town is silent — one may write
Or read in gondolas by day or night,
Having the little brazen lamp alight,
Unseen, uninterrupted; books are there,
Pictures, and casts from all those statues fair
Which were twin-born with poetry, and all
We seek in towns, with little to recall
Regrets for the green country. I might sit
In Maddalo’s great palace, and his wit
And subtle talk would cheer the winter night
And make me know myself, and the firelight
Would flash upon our faces, till the day
Might dawn and make me wonder at my stay:
But I had friends in London too: the chief
Attraction here, was that I sought relief
From the deep tenderness that maniac wrought
Within me — ’twas perhaps an idle thought —
But I imagined that if day by day
I watched him, and but seldom went away,
And studied all the beatings of his heart
With zeal, as men study some stubborn art
For their own good, and could by patience find
An entrance to the caverns of his mind,
I might reclaim him from this dark estate:
In friendships I had been most fortunate —
Yet never saw I one whom I would call
More willingly my friend; and this was all
Accomplished not; such dreams of baseless good
Oft come and go in crowds or solitude
And leave no trace — but what I now designed
Made for long years impression on my mind.
The following morning, urged by my affairs,
I left bright Venice.
After many years
And many changes I returned; the name
Of Venice, and its aspect, was the same;
But Maddalo was travelling far away
Among the mountains of Armenia.
His dog was dead. His child had now become
A woman; such as it has been my doom
To meet with few, — a wonder of this earth,
Where there is little of transcendent worth,
Like one of Shakespeare’s women: kindly she,
And, with a manner beyond courtesy,
Received her father’s friend; and when I asked
Of the lorn maniac, she her memory tasked,
And told as she had heard the mournful tale:

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r945_lg r947_q r948_l

LMNL.text: That the poor sufferer’s health began to fail

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r947_q r949_lg r950_l

LMNL.text: Two years from my departure, but that then

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r947_q r949_lg r951_l

LMNL.text: The lady who had left him, came again.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r952_lg r953_q r954_l

LMNL.text: Her mien had been imperious, but she now

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r952_lg r953_q r955_l

LMNL.text: Looked meek — perhaps remorse had brought her low.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r953_q r956_lg r957_l

LMNL.text: Her coming made him better, and they stayed

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r953_q r956_lg r958_l

LMNL.text: Together at my father’s — for I played,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r953_q r959_lg r960_l

LMNL.text: As I remember, with the lady’s shawl —

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r953_q r959_lg r961_l

LMNL.text: I might be six years old — but after all

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r953_q r962_lg r963_l

LMNL.text: She left him.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r962_lg r963_l r964_q

LMNL.text: Why, her heart must have been tough:

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r962_lg r964_q r965_l

LMNL.text: How did it end?

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r962_lg r965_l r966_q

LMNL.text: And was not this enough?

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r966_q r967_lg r968_l

LMNL.text: They met — they parted.

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r967_lg r968_l r969_q

LMNL.text: Child, is there no more?

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r967_lg r969_q r970_l

LMNL.text: Something within that interval which bore

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r969_q r971_lg r972_l

LMNL.text: The stamp of

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r969_q r971_lg r972_l r973_emph

LMNL.text: why

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r969_q r971_lg r972_l

LMNL.text: they parted,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r969_q r971_lg r972_l r974_emph

LMNL.text: how

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r969_q r971_lg r972_l

LMNL.text: they met?

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r971_lg r975_l r976_q

LMNL.text: Yet if thine aged eyes disdain to wet

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r976_q r977_lg r978_l

LMNL.text: Those wrinkled cheeks with youth’s remembered tears,

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r976_q r977_lg r979_l

LMNL.text: Ask me no more, but let the silent years

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r976_q r980_lg r981_l

LMNL.text: Be closed and cered over their memory

text.cf: r001_text r002_body r926_verse-para r976_q r980_lg r982_l

LMNL.text: As yon mute marble where their corpses lie.
I urged and questioned still, she told me how
All happened — but the cold world shall not know.
